posts.post_content:
He's a fun card, give him a chance! His first ability is great early game when you have a crap hand of all spells or all lands. Mix in some black card draw and Madness, then go for his ultimate.  
  
EDIT: I underestimated Tibalt's second ability, especially in this duel deck. His spells do so much damage that if Sorin can't gain enough life quickly enough, the second ability can end the game. Very impressed!
posts.html:
He's a fun card, give him a chance! His first ability is great early game when you have a crap hand of all spells or all lands. Mix in some black card draw and Madness, then go for his ultimate.

EDIT: I underestimated Tibalt's second ability, especially in this duel deck. His spells do so much damage that if Sorin can't gain enough life quickly enough, the second ability can end the game. Very impressed!

Posted By: darkterrorblade (3/15/2013 8:55:11 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Very very odd planeswalker. Comes in T2, at a very early stage for 2 red. Risky +1, powerful and abusive ult that will probably never see play, and -4 that is good early on.   
Tibalt get's too much bias feedback, he is worse than Koth, but in my solid opinion better than all the Chandras. Chandra the Firebrand is essentially useless, Chandra Ablaze is expensive and isn't soulfully mono red, since it comes in too late. And, Chandra Nalar, don't even get me started.   
  
A 2 MANA PLANESWALKER. Please, this card must've been pushed. When my friend plays it as early as T2, I know I'm fucked. He draws 3 lightning bolts and flashbacks the cards he discards. So good in decks that abuse graveyard-returns. I usually have 6 or 5 cards in my hand by T4 playing my Lifegain Selesnya deck, easy 5-6 damage. Then he keeps bombarding me with burns.
posts.html:

A 2 MANA PLANESWALKER. Please, this card must've been pushed. When my friend plays it as early as T2, I know I'm fucked. He draws 3 lightning bolts and flashbacks the cards he discards. Posted By: Kryptnyt (3/16/2013 6:48:16 PM)

posts.post_content:
Tibalt, The Fiend-Blooded, ah one of my favorite thematic planeswalkers, decked out in new super awesome art and looking better then ever.   
  
And yet, he is by far the Worst Planeswalker ever created. In no deck is he useful, and even in casual decks he has to compete with commons that are more then capable of doing his job better.   
  
Compared to his rival [Sorin, Lord of Innistrad](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin, Lord of Innistrad), he is a joke. Sorin comes down and can immediately drop down an emblem AND still have loyalty kicking around. If Tibalt wants to drop his -4 to do 0-5 damage, a lousy effect in comparison, he has to spend two on random looting AND kill himself in the process. Sorin can ult immediately after three turns of getting the benefits of his token, while Tibalt has to spend 4 turns on an ability that is a downside half the time before even getting to ultimate, and Tibalt has virtually no chance of getting use out of it.  
 Even counting the fact that Tibalt can come out two turns earlier, his -4 come... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

If Tibalt wants to drop his -4 to do 0-5 damage, a lousy effect in comparison, he has to spend two on random looting AND kill himself in the process. Sorin can ult immediately after three turns of getting the benefits of his token, while Tibalt has to spend 4 turns on an ability that is a downside half the time before even getting to ultimate, and Tibalt has virtually no chance of getting use out of it.

posts.post_content:
Hey guys I accidentally put an [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) and a [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) in Tibalt's Deck and he suddenly started winning a lot more. B|   
  
So I decided to go a bit further and put in [Buried Alive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Buried Alive), [Sickening Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sickening Dreams), [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress), and [Zombie Infestation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Zombie Infestation). :)p  
  
Turns out [Recoup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Recoup)ing [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead) is good. Who knew. Oh and I highly suggest that people who already have their Premium Decks go ahead and do everything evil you realize I'm about to tell you to do, since he is in these colors >:D

1x [Scourge Devil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scourge Devil)  
1x [Gang of Devils](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gang of Devils)  
2x [Scorched Rusalka](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scorched Rusalka )   
1x [Skirsdag Cultist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirsdag Cultist)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Tibalt: IT'S OVER [SORIN](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=SORIN)! I HAVE THE [HIGH GROUND](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=HIGH GROUND)! >:D  
  
Sorin: B\*tch-Please -\_- You underestimate my SPARKLES :p  
  
^and that is the Story of Duel Decks: Sorin vs. Tibalt.   
  
Or, How Sorin Markov [Murder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murder)ed Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded.   
  
(aftermath: he was charged with Second Degree Murder of a Helpless Opponent, and First Degree Bad Assery for Giant Sword Owning. The fine was two mana, not even a temporary suspension of Planeswalking for Walking without a License. :3)  
  
(seriously, until Tibalt learns how to cast [Dreadbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreadbore), this is the most Foregone Conclusion Duel Deck ever. This box should be renamed: Duel Decks: [Sorin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sorin) vs. [Hellrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellrider) x) But I am far too entertained by the ridiculousness to be actually mad :D)
posts.html:
Tibalt: IT'S OVER SORIN! I HAVE THE HIGH GROUND! >:D

Sorin: B*tch-Please -_- You underestimate my SPARKLES :p

^and that is the Story of Duel Decks: Sorin vs. Tibalt.

Or, How Sorin Markov Murdered Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded.

(aftermath: he was charged with Second Degree Murder of a Helpless Opponent, and First Degree Bad Assery for Giant Sword Owning. The fine was two mana, not even a temporary suspension of Planeswalking for Walking without a License. :3)

(seriously, until Tibalt learns how to cast Dreadbore, this is the most Foregone Conclusion Duel Deck ever. This box should be renamed: Duel Decks: Sorin vs. Hellrider x) But I am far too entertained by the ridiculousness to be actually mad :D)

Posted By: MagicCritic (5/5/2013 11:52:17 AM)

posts.post_content:
I'm torn. I think his plus one is the problem. If it was "Draw a card, discard a card" it would be too powerful. I love his deck though. Basically a you have no right choice deck. The gf hates it.
  
   
Also has an interesting synergy with [Seal of fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of fire) and [Seal of Doom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seal of Doom), because it takes those out of your hand. Convenient that it fits in the deck. Should have been included, particularly since it's black red.
posts.html:

Also has an interesting synergy with Seal of fire and Seal of Doom, because it takes those out of your hand. Convenient that it fits in the deck. Should have been included, particularly since it's black red.

posts.post_content: Tibalt is still my favorite planeswalker. Not because he's game altering, overpowered, or flexible, but because he's extremely subtle. Flashback decks love this cheeky bastard, and I ran one with 2x of him just to use the card nobody expects to perform. My only gripe about him is that his minus 4 could have been a minus 3 and still been far from broken.
posts.html:

Posted By: HappyJackington (4/22/2013 8:50:26 AM)

posts.post_content: I split this duel deck with a buddy of mine. He paid 25 bucks for all if it and sold me this for 5$, two intangible virtues and a lingering souls. I have yet to lose the matchup. Which is weird, since Sorin's deck appears far superior. I suppose what I have to say there is that this little guy is a LOT better than he looks on paper. Don't knock em until you play him. You will be pleasantly surprised. I cannot give a card that has single handedly saved the game for me less than 4/5. Extra points for the coat. 4.5/5
posts.html:

Posted By: Stinga (4/20/2013 6:47:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Why is it when I see this face with that knife I think he's saying, "You wanna know how I got these scars? You see, my father was a necroalchemist, and a fiend. One night he went off a little crazier than usual, and mommy got the scalpel to defend herself. He didn't like that. So he takes the scalpel to her, laughing while he does it, and then he sees me. He walks towards me and asks, "Why so serious?"  
And he sticks the scalpel in my mouth, and says again, "Why so serious?"  
  
"Let's put a smile on that face!"  
Why is it I feel like that would be tibalt's flavor text if planeswalkers had flavor text?

He walks towards me and asks, "Why so serious?"
And he sticks the scalpel in my mouth, and says again, "Why so serious?"
